page.title: 12Education in Gourdon
page.content: In the mid 19th century a school was opened in Queen Street at which attendance was voluntary. It was funded partly by an endowment and by the pupils paying fees of 1d. per day. By 1868 a large and successful day school had started in the{Mission {Hall.}More than 200 children attended and one sole female teacher taught over 100 during the morning and the same again in the afternoon. Two years after the Education Act of 1873 the first purpose built school was built and served the village until it was {destroyed by fire in 1955.}A new 4 teacher school was built on the same site although in the 1980's the school roll fell to less than 40 so that the school became a{2 teacher unit,}one of the spare classrooms being then used by the Village Playgroup and Mother and Toddlers Group.
